name: Abdul Rahman
text:
AbhaHigh City is located in Abha, Saudi Arabia and is one of the most visited places in the region. Located at 2200 meters, Abha is famous for being one of the highest cities in Saudi Arabia. Because of its altitude, the temperatures here are milder as compared to the rest of the country.

The Abha High City is located in front of the Aseer national park. Inside the city, the infrastructure gives off a European look. Nestled in the middle of mountains that are riddled with valleys, the city offers fresh air and stunning views of the surrounding hilly areas. Due to its location, this place is also known as the 'High City.' At times the mountains can get foggy with clouds reaching the city, providing tourists with a surreal view. In summers, this is a popular destination for many tourists escaping the desert heat.

Although the city is going through upgrades, there are still multiple gift shops, restaurants, and coffee shops. There is also an art wall in the middle of the city, in front of which tourists can take their pictures. Some of the food stalls can be expensive and often families bring their own snacks to have a picnic and enjoy the view. A golf cart is available in the city as the walk up can be difficult for children and older people.

For families wanting to take some time off from the hustle and bustle of central Abhasavour, the atmosphere here is quite peaceful. Cable cars are also installed nearby. The views get even better at night. However, the place can get crowded after 3 pm and visits are recommended during early daytime.

name: Anonymous 4928
text: The place is great, there is a wide amount of cafes accessible with nice views, a very gorgeous landscape view of the mountains and the city and abha and if you are lucky enough some monkeys passing by, the only problems are that the toilets have no handle which makes it hard to use the bathroom while closing it all the toilets are arabic stand up style, and the cable cars are 10 minutes away from the place even so it says that it is locate inside high city

name: Abdullah Al Khathami
text: High City in Abha is a captivating place known for its stunning views and cool weather. Located on a mountain, it offers breathtaking views of the surrounding area. The place is popular for its charming cafes and restaurants, where visitors can enjoy a variety of foods while enjoying the scenery. High City also has beautifully landscaped parks and walking paths, making it a great spot for relaxing and taking leisurely walks. With its mix of natural beauty and modern amenities, High City is a must-visit in Abha.

name: Gareth Armstrong
text: Got there and you could barely see as the area was engulfed in cloud. Had an amazing cinnamon latte in the fog cafe and all of a sudden the cloud disappeared. Photos don't do it justice, an incredible sight and loved it.

name: Leonard Gado
text: A very nice place for vacation, locals are so hospitable, you should try it for your satisfaction, lots of cafes, store, and there is cable car for 100 riyals for you to see the entire high city, the most happy part was the rain, feels like you are in different world, i will come back soon

name: FAYIZ ABOOBACKER
text:
Abha is renowned for its natural beauty and diverse landscapes. Here are some notable aspects of Abha's nature and places:

1. **Asir National Park**: This vast park offers a variety of landscapes, including forests, mountains, and valleys. It’s a popular spot for hiking, picnicking, and nature watching.

2. **Al-Soudah Park**: Located near Abha, this park is known for its cool climate, lush greenery, and panoramic views from the mountain.

3. **Habala Village**: Famous for its traditional hanging houses built on cliffs, it’s a striking example of local architecture and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

4. **Rijal Alma Village**: A historical village with well-preserved traditional architecture and vibrant cultural heritage, offering insight into the region’s history and culture.

5. **Abha Dam**: A scenic spot ideal for relaxation and enjoying views of the surrounding mountains and the reservoir.

6. **Al-Muftaha Village**: Known for its cultural and artistic activities, this area features traditional markets, art galleries, and handicraft shops.

7. **Jabal Sawda**: The highest peak in Saudi Arabia, providing breathtaking views and a cool climate.

These locations highlight Abha’s appeal as a destination for nature lovers and those interested in exploring Saudi Arabia’s diverse landscapes and cultural heritage.

name: Abdullah Al Khathami
text: Yes, the Art Street in Abha is a vibrant and culturally rich area known for its artistic atmosphere. This lively street is adorned with colorful murals and art installations, showcasing the creativity and talent of local artists. It’s a popular destination for both locals and tourists who appreciate art and culture. Along the street, you can find galleries, cafes, and shops selling unique artworks and handmade crafts. The Art Street is a must-visit spot for anyone looking to immerse themselves in the artistic spirit of Abha.

name: Cherie May (CM LI)
text:
The area right now is full of people because of the eid.

No flowers for this season but still a good place to Check out when you're in the area

name: Rachel C
text: This is a nice place to walk around. The gardens and plants are beautiful, with many flowers and purple flowering trees. There are playgrounds for kids and many people being picnic blankets and sit. There are some stands to sell food and art, but not as many as I’d hoped. Parking wasn’t as bad as I thought.

name: Zohra Azhar
text: Awesome place. Very neat and clean and full of flowers and greenery. I went off season so was not able to catch the purple trees nor was the street covered with umbrellas, but nevertheless I enjoyed the cool breeze and refreshing air from the numerous trees. There are huts places at internals where you can have picnics with  your family and there is a fully functional cafe on the park's premises for coffee and other snacking items. Go in the spring months and this place will be more beautiful than the pictures I've shared.

name: rehan yousuf
text: Go there according to weather. There is viewpoint on the. Click and rest there. Then go ahead. Stop on main point and spend time there. Take snacks and food. Hunger-station was delivering food at the top also.

name: Muhammad TARIQ
text:
Excellent Place. If you are going by your car. Then you must have
1. Chairs
2. Mat
Why do these two things. Because you will wish to sit at some place and have a nice hour or two.
Low Temperature
Very ncie environment

name: Dr.Hegazy Haddad
text: A gorgeous place with a great atmosphere and beautiful views you can see all Abha covered with clouds l love it so much even I went twice to enjoy it

name: Rachel C
text: The views are great. We were told that 10 or 11am is the best time to arrive, but unfortunately there weren’t clouds, fog, nor rain. There are plenty of places to pull your car to the side of the road and enjoy the views, or there’s a large parking lot at the top with great views. You can look off both sides of the mountain but one side is less developed than the other.

name: faiza khan
text: Breathtaking view...It rained with hailstorm....Must visit....too high on the hill

name: Semeer Ibrahim Kallare
text:
The best Souq in Al Ahsa. Bargain is a must here and make sure you get a good product for the same.
Local made products are good but not all.

name: KASHIF RIZWAN
text:
It is a very expensive Market if you are planning to buy some gold then it is not a good place they charge you more than 360SAR for 1gm of gold of 21k but the price of the gold would be around 271 SAR for 21k gold.
I would rather suggest going to gold outlets such as Malabar where you could get one price across the kingdom and they usually give discounts on making charges too, so if you are a first time gold buyer then buy from such outlets.

The souq is most probably the place for chilling out rather than shopping.

PRO TIP:- if you are looking to buy some abayas then buy from the shop on the side of the road rather than the backyard shops as the price they offer in the front row shops are usually fixed and are kept according to the quality of the material.

name: Zabiullah Najeeb
text: Towering shelves, meticulously organized, overflowed with countless volumes, each one a potential portal to new worlds. The environment itself was pure invitation: a haven of tranquility bathed in warm light, offering ample space to curl up with a chosen treasure.

name: Harvey Specter
text: I had high expectations for the Ithra Children Museum and Library in Dammam, but I left extremely disappointed. First, the library requires an annual membership fee of 150 riyals, which only allows you to borrow 5 books every two weeks. This is highly impractical. To make matters worse, we read him 5 books a night! Are we seriously expected to wait two weeks just to renew his books? Overall, I’m extremely dissatisfied with our experience and won’t be returning anytime soon. This place needs serious improvements.

name: Aamna Khan
text: The place is very quiet and well maintained. There is a variety of books of different genres and languages. I love its interior it's very unique and intriguing. The architect has done a great job. The sitting areas are unique. There is a cafe inside. The books are divided based on different age groups and are on different levels. Kids have different floor dedicated to them to enjoy books of their age.

name: Owais Bhat
text: The experience was amazing. The Ithra has been developed beautifully with the library being the core attraction. You can easily spend a full day there and not know about time. The atmosphere is so calming that it is meant for readers and helps you read more and more.

name: Salman Khan
text: Ethraa Library is a haven for book enthusiasts, offering a diverse collection that caters to all interests. The cozy ambiance invites hours of immersive reading, while its engaging events foster a sense of literary community. With passionate staff and well-organized shelves, it's a treasure trove for knowledge seekers, providing both solace and thought-provoking discussions.

name: Nahid Aldossary
text: Very very nice and colorful place for picnic and family time. Clean and well taken care of.  Has some good coffee shops and restaurant.

name: Slim S
text: Nice and luscious place to visit. Full of flowers and vegetation. Beautiful tree house and open grassy green hills.

name: Reyn Basuel
text: most beautiful park and playground in camp; pop-up restaurants and cafes were opened during the cold season. at the time when the restaurants and cafes aren't there, we frequent this place for the playground, sitting under the trees, watchings the ducks and birds at the pond, or enjoying a walk at the trail. lovely place.

name: Ahmed A. Kassem
text: The park is amazing now, new restaurant, new decorations, interactive wall. The best recreation area I have seen

name: Dana
text: Nice place with rainy day, the urth caffe was not professional with crowded and waiting list customers.. but the service inside the restaurant was good.. we had special night, Thank you Aramco for this Pop Up.

name: swalih veluthedath
text: Modon Lake is a beautiful urban retreat in Modon City. The clean, spacious lake is perfect for relaxation and recreation, with walking paths, picnic spots, and playgrounds for families. The boardwalk offers great views, and nearby cafes and restaurants add to the appeal. Overall, Modon Lake is a well-designed area that blends city life with nature.

name: Ranjith kumar
text: Not maintaining well. Full of dirty. In kids playing area dusty and filled with rain water. Kids will get disappointed when they see the play area. For adults it’s decent place.

name: SHIVENDRA KUMAR PANDEY
text: Very good place for morning walk ,  piece full ,  mind Relaxing 😴 park

name: kids stuff
text: Nice lake and sorrounding park. Kids enjoyed in the park. Only the thing is there is no lighting available after sunset. Also the play area was logged with filthy water. The water in the lake is also not good, children cannot play in the water. As mentioned on Wikipedia "Modon sold treated water suitable for industrial use, converted sewage and industrial wastewater into renewable treated water, and filtered the surplus to the second industrial city lake with its biological and plant components." Anyhow my kids caught small baby fishes on the edges of the lake.

name: Umm Sameer
text: A beautiful public park with a huge lake and lots of trees. So green and amazing. Clean and we'll maintained with public toilets as well as public playgrounds for kids. However, there is no coffee shop or restaurant. So bring your own snacks or your stuff for a picnic.

name: Hashim Shakeeb
text: A calm place to relax by watching the different types of ducks and their actions like swimming, walking in line and quacking together. This long corniche is attracting families and kids with many activities. Plenty of parking availability and kids play areas are very interesting.

name: amjed ahamed
text: Duck Lake is the perfect choice. Its serene ambiance, impeccable cleanliness, and family-friendly facilities make it an ideal spot for relaxation and recreation. Highly recommended!

name: islam karam
text: Good place to enjoy with your family , clean & can take a small ride in the lake also there is a kids play ground close from it

name: Suniel Patil
text: The best location to enjoy with kids L, definitely watching several kinds of ducks together is beautiful. Enjoying an evening with walk around the sea with beautiful duck lake is awesome. Well maintained, a must visit place with family, having plenty of parking area, and nearby kids play area none should miss.

name: Vishnudas C.
text: One of the best places in Khobar to spend time with Family.  Weekends and evenings are crowded. Plenty of parking available. Best place to see the Sunrise. Mornings and evenings are great here.

name: Dr. Shah Hussain
text: The King Fahad Park is one of the largest park in the eastern region of Saudi Arabia located in the middle of Dammam, Dhahran and Khobar. This the most attractive project in the region to provide happiness and comfort to the citizens and residents. The entire look and design of the park is unique based on benefiting from the natural conditions surrounding the site in terms of shape and heights. On the eastern side of the park there is an artificial Swan lake having boats for kids entertainment. The park is good for friends and families gathering. Big free parking space .

name: Shaukath Mangalore
text: King Fahad Park is located just adjacent to the Iskan Buildings in Dammam.  This public park has a lot of greenery and big trees are lined up on the sides of the park area. It is truly amazing to admire the serene greenery of the park along with jogging, walking, cycling, playing football, cricket, Volleyball, flying kite, skate board and roller board. It is perfect place for picnic get together with family or friends,  The entry to the park is free & it has lots of free parking space available. The park is well maintained with clean toilets. To conclude, I will recommend this park a must visit for all.

name: Aman MS
text: It's a spacious park with play areas for kids and adults (Many youths play cricket here.) The park is usually filled with people till late night. Good number of large groups trees gives plenty of shade.

name: Dyah Aprilia
text: Its a garden or park with space big area. Good area for jogging, walking, picnic, sitting, meeting with family or friends, playing ball, kite, or skateboard and rollerblad. Many tree in there and grass, soo we can see green view. Location near dammam iskan, strategic location, easily to find. Parking free not pay and enter this garden free also no pay. Environment clean, neat, and fresh. There available toilet and for wheelchair parking. Lets come and join us🏜🤗🤗

name: Muhammad Usman
text: Best garden for outdoor family gathering Public rest rooms available Kids playing area Jogging tack Now vegetable Market for Abdullah fawad also shift here

name: Balaji Ramu
text: A pleasant, well maintained walk way and lawns for families to spend time.. access to water in some sections of the walk ways, people do fishing.

name: Shaiful Islam (Shawon)
text: A beautiful corniche with stunning views of the Arabian Gulf. Perfect for a relaxing stroll, bike ride, or picnic. There's also a playground for kids and plenty of restaurants nearby.

name: Mubashir Khan
text: One of the most beautiful and elegant places in Dammam where we can stay with our family members for hours to enjoy the natural beauty with the shore of water. This is a well maintained park which includes Albaik, Street Tea coffee and some other eatable items. Well, one can walk alone or along with the family members. Kids are enjoying while playing. This Corniche have Masjid and restroom Pictures and video for reference

name: وجه
text: A decent place attached to city where you can go for a nice walk with family. Depending on the weather conditions you can spend a good evening time having food or snacks there. You can ride bike as well. The sea view is calming. There is not other much to do there. Food options are not there but you can find tea and coffee stalls. Electric cars and bikes for children are also available. Slides and swings are there for your kids.

name: Ziva David
text: Lovely view of the  Tarout Bay ( part of Arabian gulf) amidst the hustle and bustle of Dammam. Wide space area, well lit, lot of spaces to sit and explore yourself. Nice place to enjoy and see when you are in Dammam

name: Nabilah Abdullah
text: It's a good place to play indoors with kids. They have many games. Mini bowling,theme rides,jumping area,arcade games, ball pit play area and some food stalls inside. The staff at ticket redemption counter for prizes are also generous and kind. It does get crowded though, best time is weekdays.

name: Nabilah H. Abdullah
text: It's a theme park for indoor games. It has many games. Newly renovated play areas!! New play area which is huge, it has a ballpit,tire slide,normal slides and a huge trampoline  area, all for one bracelet is 45sr on normal days but 25sar on Tuesday and Wednesday. It is crowded on weekends, best time to visit on weekdays. Promo days are #mondays is an entry bracelet for 55sar for all games. #Tuesdays and Wednesdays 50% off on all games

name: Zaid Durrani
text: Cashier staff leave earlier then they should. The yemni security guard with curly hairs need some ethical orientation, he was misbehaving with all non Arab families.

name: Mahendra Vakati
text: Small indoor amusement park and congested with lot of rides and games... Felt the prices are expensive but they are giving some offers if you are loading money into the card... The best value is on MONDAY's because you will get unlimited rides for just SR 50... It was crowned when we visited today may be due to eid... Video games are same as any other parks in saudi arabia... Some of the games were not working... The tickets were not working for some games... The prices/items for the tickets are very expensive... If you don't want to spend much money just visit on Mondays (I guess some of the rides are not included in this... So verify before going for this)

name: Ahmed A. Kassem
text: Nice place with good atmosphere. The prices are good to moderate. The jungle cafe is wonderful with amazing prices

name: janda Hual
text: Not very crowded when we visited The towels arent included in the entrance fee. No shampoos or shower gels available And you have to pay extra for the locker. But the pools and beach areas were clean 🙏🏽💚

name: Della Abudi
text: Very nice

name: Asif Khan
text: All is 4 Star plus

name: samaher alhazaa
text: Incredible 🥹♥️

name: Shahad Saqer
text: As for the resort, I lived there for four nights. The resort is considered a bit old. As for the price, I find it very exaggerated, since there are no diverse options for food inside the resort. I mean, the nearest place is half an hour away from you, and its location is considered a piece of paper. To be honest, I expected it to be cleaner than that I expected. It is more developed. It lacks many things. Wi-Fi. Anything that interrupts what you see is a suitable option or a first destination for safety. Also, there are no permanent activities for visitors to add a spirit of joy to the place. The water games are old and dilapidated. The villas are considered small in size, but the staff and workers have very nice morals. This is my opinion about it.

name: white Cloud
text: Finally, there is a water park, especially for women. I booked my tickets online it's easier than you book there. There is a restaurant, cafe, and beach beside the water slides. It's suitable for both kids and adults. Taking photos is not allowed because of the client's privacy. I enjoyed this experience and of course, I will come again

name: Turki Alkhudair
text: My family’s review about this : Thank you to all the staff at Loopagoon for your warm welcome and hospitality. My family had a great time and they look forward to returning soon. Everything was excellent, and they rate the venue and organization 8.5/10. The only issue they had was (the cold water, especially in the children's play area) this is such a wonderful place for summer, keep up the good work .

name: Dr. Sarah Raashid Aijaz
text: Unfortunately, even if you arrive early or purchase tickets in advance, the lengthy queue and lack of priority for pre-booked guests mean you'll still have to wait outside in the heat. This disappointing situation negates the efforts made to expedite entry, making the pre-purchase of tickets feel like a wasted effort. It's frustrating to experience such a lack of consideration for guests' comfort and convenience for the only ladies water park in the eastern province. Furthermore, the venue was overcrowded and there was lack of cleanliness. Loopagoon should take care of these factors since it has been a long time since it has opened.

name: Amnah Turkistani
text: Crowded … no WIFI … you need to control the number of guests inside… limits are required in such places… too much people… not enough toilets and showers… and the fast food bad quality…  last time over there.

name: Robot Sam
text: Dear Mgt team, Please confirm if the family(having males also) allowed on Saturday as stated on the website? The reason to re-confirm here is that someone in the reviews said they(male) were turned away.

name: Kalimulla Kattubadi
text: Pleasant beach. Nice view. Had a fun with sandy beach. Lot of parking available. There are washrooms available for bathing after beach activities. Washrooms are not clean. Need lot of improvements in neatness. Would be appreciate if some local shops available for anything to buy for foodstuffs. Kids enjoyed a lot.

name: Oi Oi
text: This place were amazing it have many amenities and things that you can do. You can ride a horse,camel and Atv, they were all very affordable and it has the access to beach which are cozy and relax after a long day of play outdoors. In the beach you can relax in their villa and you can enjoy doing barbecue. One of my favourite place.

name: Nars Salie
text: What more could you ask for? This beach is perfect for enjoying the water in the hot summertime, with a clean seashore and cottages.

name: MOHAMMED NASEER UDDIN
text: Excellent beach to enjoy the nature. You can enjoy at the beach. Small hut like structures help you out to cook food / barbeque

name: Aisha Idrees
text: Had the best memories here! People come here and live for daaaays in the huts, they’re free for anyone to choose. Heard they are renovating the huts at the moment. This is our childhood beach and I really hope when the huts reopen they are even better than before! 🩵🌊🐳

name: Christophine Varghese
text: Excellent place to visit. Museum is on the 2nd floor. Food on the ground floor was yum. Good service. Can spend 2-3 hours there. Adults ticket fee 20 SR and kids 10 and below free. Totally worth it.

name: Lexie Perez
text: It was a great experience touring this place, we spent around more than an hour to explore this museum/restaurant. The staff are very accommodating and you will really learn a lot about history and culture of saudi from the short tour. Also good for the pictures and a great experience with friends. We’ll plan to come next time and try their extensive menu.

name: Anas Gulzar
text: Heritage Village in Dammam is a fantastic spot. It's both a museum and a restaurant. It showcases many traditional artifacts and serves delicious Saudi cuisine. It's a fun and interesting experience! 😍🫶❤️

name: SAJIN JANARDHANAN
text: It's a must visit place in dammam.The Heritage Village in Dammam is the name of the place where you can meet the past of Saudi Arabia and the heritage of its regions, on an area that extends to 21,000 square meters. Its beautiful architecture hides within it a rich history.

name: Марина Шаврина
text: It was good. The restaurant is delicious and the museum is very interesting for tourist, but there is a problem. It isn’t information about some exposition, and you need to use your internet or something else to be understandable
